Having been in business for three years, Whoosh NG has fulfilled more than 20,000 deliveries locally and globally. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Officer&nbsp;(Sales / BD Department)
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Key Account Officer will be responsible for managing and nurturing relationships with WhooshNG&#39;s clients.
	This role requires a proactive, client-focused professional who can build trust, ensure client satisfaction, and drive business growth through excellent account management and service delivery oversight.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the primary point of contact for clients, ensuring their needs are met promptly and effectively.
	Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients to build trust and loyalty.
	Track delivery and resolve any issues or complaints in a timely manner.
	Identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell WhooshNG&rsquo;s services to existing clients.
	Coordinate with operations to ensure smooth and efficient delivery processes.
	Provide clients with regular updates on their deliveries and overall account performance.
	Conduct periodic client reviews to gather feedback and recommend improvements.
	Develop strategies to increase client retention and satisfaction.
	Work towards meeting revenue targets and business growth objectives.


Qualifications &amp; Skills


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Logistics, or related fields.
	1 - 2 years of experience in customer relations, or sales (preferably in logistics, supply chain, or e-commerce).
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to build and maintain long-term professional relationships.
	Problem-solving mindset with strong attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
	Knowledge of logistics, delivery services, or supply chain management is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@whoosh.com.ng&nbsp;using &quot;Key Account Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

  "description": "Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, a multinational Oil and Gas company in Nigeria, is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contracts Engineer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos &amp; Rivers
Employment Type: Ful-time

Job Purpose


	The Contracts Engineer shall be responsible for the management of contracts and agreements, ensuring they are strategically sourced, competitively tendered, and robustly administered.
	This role safeguards Company&#39;s commercial and legal interests, mitigates contractual risk, and fosters strong, performance-driven relationships with vendors and clients to support successful project execution and operational excellence.


Key Responsibilities &amp; Duties


	Shall be responsible for driving the entire contract lifecycle, from initial tender to final close-out, ensuring all agreements are strategically sound and administratively robust.
	Shall support the CCM Lead in piloting the end-to-end tender process, including the preparation of Invitations to Tender (ITT) and coordination of pre-bid meetings and clarifications.
	Shall participate in conducting thorough technical and commercial bid evaluations, prepare award recommendations for the management consideration
	Shall actively participate in managing performance, correspondence, variations, and fostering strong, performance-driven relationships with vendors.
	Shall administer the formal change management process for contracts, evaluating, and documenting all variations and change orders.
	Shall review contractor invoices and payment certificates, verify alignment with contractual terms and actual work progress with the project management team.
	Shall proactively identify, assess, and mitigate contractual risks while ensuring full compliance with company policies and relevant regulations.
	Shall support the management of contractual claims and works with the project team to resolve disputes, maintaining comprehensive records throughout the process.
	Shall support the contractual close-out of projects, and contribute to lessons learned to support the development of the Approved Vendor List (AVL).


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	% of contracts awarded within the approved budget and schedule.
	Reduction in contractual disputes and claims.
	Compliance with tender and contract management procedures.
	Timeliness and accuracy of contract documentation and reporting.
	Vendor performance feedback and contract close-out effectiveness.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Education:&nbsp;Bachelor&#39;s degree in Law, Business Administration, or any relevant course. A Master&#39;s degree or professional certification (e.g., CIPS, RICS) is highly desirable.
	Experience: Minimum of 2-5 years of progressive experience in contract engineering or administration, specifically within the Oil &amp; Gas, Energy, or EPCI project environment.


Technical Skills:


	In-depth knowledge of contract law, different forms of contract (e.g., FIDIC, LOGIC, BIMCO), and contracting strategies.
	Proven experience in tender preparation, bid evaluation, and contract negotiation.
	Proficiency in using Vendor Management Systems and ERP systems.
	Strong understanding of project management principles and project lifecycle.


Competencies &amp; Behavioural Attributes:


	Excellent negotiation and influencing skills, with the ability to secure favourableterms.
	Meticulous attention to detail and strong analytical skills for complex contract review and analysis.
	Proactive in identifying and mitigating commercial risks before they materialize.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for clear and effective correspondence and reporting.
	Unquestioned ethics and integrity, ensuring all dealings are transparent and compliant.


Method of Application&nbsp;METHOD OF APPLICATION
Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com

Contracts Engineer Job at Maventeq Systems Limited




        
    

        
        Maventeq Systems Limited - Our client, a multinational Oil and Gas company in Nigeria, is currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Contracts Engineer

Job Locations: Lagos & Rivers
Employment Type: Ful-time

Job Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Contracts Engineer shall be responsible for the management of contracts and agreements, ensuring they are strategically sourced, competitively tendered, and robustly administered.
	This role safeguards Company's commercial and legal interests, mitigates contractual risk, and fosters strong, performance-driven relationships with vendors and clients to support successful project execution and operational excellence.


Key Responsibilities & Duties


	Shall be responsible for driving the entire contract lifecycle, from initial tender to final close-out, ensuring all agreements are strategically sound and administratively robust.
	Shall support the CCM Lead in piloting the end-to-end tender process, including the preparation of Invitations to Tender (ITT) and coordination of pre-bid meetings and clarifications.
	Shall participate in conducting thorough technical and commercial bid evaluations, prepare award recommendations for the management consideration
	Shall actively participate in managing performance, correspondence, variations, and fostering strong, performance-driven relationships with vendors.
	Shall administer the formal change management process for contracts, evaluating, and documenting all variations and change orders.
	Shall review contractor invoices and payment certificates, verify alignment with contractual terms and actual work progress with the project management team.
	Shall proactively identify, assess, and mitigate contractual risks while ensuring full compliance with company policies and relevant regulations.
	Shall support the management of contractual claims and works with the project team to resolve disputes, maintaining comprehensive records throughout the process.
	Shall support the contractual close-out of projects, and contribute to lessons learned to support the development of the Approved Vendor List (AVL).


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	% of contracts awarded within the approved budget and schedule.
	Reduction in contractual disputes and claims.
	Compliance with tender and contract management procedures.
	Timeliness and accuracy of contract documentation and reporting.
	Vendor performance feedback and contract close-out effectiveness.


Qualifications & Experience


	Education: Bachelor's degree in Law, Business Administration, or any relevant course. A Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CIPS, RICS) is highly desirable.
	Experience: Minimum of 2-5 years of progressive experience in contract engineering or administration, specifically within the Oil & Gas, Energy, or EPCI project environment.


Technical Skills:


	In-depth knowledge of contract law, different forms of contract (e.g., FIDIC, LOGIC, BIMCO), and contracting strategies.
	Proven experience in tender preparation, bid evaluation, and contract negotiation.
	Proficiency in using Vendor Management Systems and ERP systems.
	Strong understanding of project management principles and project lifecycle.


Competencies & Behavioural Attributes:


	Excellent negotiation and influencing skills, with the ability to secure favourableterms.
	Meticulous attention to detail and strong analytical skills for complex contract review and analysis.
	Proactive in identifying and mitigating commercial risks before they materialize.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills for clear and effective correspondence and reporting.
	Unquestioned ethics and integrity, ensuring all dealings are transparent and compliant.


Method of Application METHOD OF APPLICATION
Candidates should send their CV to: careers@maventeqsystems.com

Note: Only candidates who meet the job requirements will be contacted.

  "description": "Genesis is a wholly Nigerian owned group with business interests in hotels, restaurants, cinemas, shopping malls, real estate development, catering and snack foods. For twenty five years, we have provided &#39;exceptional products and services&#39; to multinationals, local corporations and the Nigerian public.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Warri, Asaba - Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We&rsquo;re looking for a driven, hands on Restaurant Manager who thrives in a fast-paced environment and genuinely enjoys leading people. The ideal candidate has an instinct for operational excellence, a passion for customer service, and the ability to bring out the best in their team.
	This role isn&rsquo;t just about managing it&rsquo;s about creating an atmosphere where both guests and employees feel valued, energized, and proud of the work being done every day.
	(We also believe that great leadership comes in many forms. Female professionals with strong people and operational skills are especially encouraged to apply your perspective and leadership style are highly valued in our growing team.)


Key Responsibilities
Daily Operations &amp; Service Excellence:


	Oversee all aspects of daily restaurant operations, ensuring speed, quality, and accuracy in every order.
	Maintain high standards of food safety, cleanliness, and product presentation in line with company and regulatory guidelines.
	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, labor, and waste, making real-time adjustments to achieve daily targets.


Team Leadership &amp; Development:


	Lead, train, and motivate a team of shift leaders and crew members to deliver outstanding service and teamwork.
	Conduct regular coaching sessions, performance reviews, and hands-on training to build confidence and accountability.
	Foster a positive work culture that encourages initiative, respect, and ownership among all team members.


Guest Experience:


	Lead by example in creating a welcoming, efficient, and friendly environment for every guest.
	Resolve customer concerns quickly and effectively, turning challenges into opportunities to build loyalty.
	Monitor service flow and make proactive adjustments to ensure guests are served promptly and accurately.


Financial &amp; Operational Performance:


	Manage daily cash handling, inventory control, and cost management to meet profit and loss (P&amp;L) objectives.
	Analyze sales trends and local market dynamics to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.
	Execute marketing or promotional initiatives at the store level to drive traffic and sales.


Compliance &amp; Safety:


	Ensure full compliance with health, safety, and labor regulations at all times.
	Conduct regular audits of kitchen, storage, and dining areas to maintain standards.
	Manage incident reporting and follow-up actions in coordination with the Operations team.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 3-10 years of experience.


Method of Application

Restaurant Manager Job at Genesis Restaurant




        
    

        
        Genesis is a wholly Nigerian owned group with business interests in hotels, restaurants, cinemas, shopping malls, real estate development, catering and snack foods. Genesis has its corporate head office in Port Harcourt, Rivers State. For twenty five years, we have provided 'exceptional products and services' to multinationals, local corporations and the Nigerian public.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Manager

Job Location: Warri, Asaba - Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a driven, hands on Restaurant Manager who thrives in a fast-paced environment and genuinely enjoys leading people. The ideal candidate has an instinct for operational excellence, a passion for customer service, and the ability to bring out the best in their team.
	This role isn’t just about managing it’s about creating an atmosphere where both guests and employees feel valued, energized, and proud of the work being done every day.
	(We also believe that great leadership comes in many forms. Female professionals with strong people and operational skills are especially encouraged to apply your perspective and leadership style are highly valued in our growing team.)


Key Responsibilities
Daily Operations & Service Excellence:


	Oversee all aspects of daily restaurant operations, ensuring speed, quality, and accuracy in every order.
	Maintain high standards of food safety, cleanliness, and product presentation in line with company and regulatory guidelines.
	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, labor, and waste, making real-time adjustments to achieve daily targets.


Team Leadership & Development:


	Lead, train, and motivate a team of shift leaders and crew members to deliver outstanding service and teamwork.
	Conduct regular coaching sessions, performance reviews, and hands-on training to build confidence and accountability.
	Foster a positive work culture that encourages initiative, respect, and ownership among all team members.


Guest Experience:


	Lead by example in creating a welcoming, efficient, and friendly environment for every guest.
	Resolve customer concerns quickly and effectively, turning challenges into opportunities to build loyalty.
	Monitor service flow and make proactive adjustments to ensure guests are served promptly and accurately.


Financial & Operational Performance:


	Manage daily cash handling, inventory control, and cost management to meet profit and loss (P&L) objectives.
	Analyze sales trends and local market dynamics to identify opportunities for growth and improvement.
	Execute marketing or promotional initiatives at the store level to drive traffic and sales.


Compliance & Safety:


	Ensure full compliance with health, safety, and labor regulations at all times.
	Conduct regular audits of kitchen, storage, and dining areas to maintain standards.
	Manage incident reporting and follow-up actions in coordination with the Operations team.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3-10 years of experience.


Method of Application
